subject: Investing
title: Understanding Volume and Liquidity
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Understanding Volume and Liquidity.

hook.text: Apple trades 50 million shares daily. A tiny biotech trades 5,000. Guess which one is easier to sell in a panic.

buildup.text: Volume is how many shares change hands. Liquidity is how easily you can buy or sell without moving the price.

discovery.text: High volume means tight spreads and fast fills. Low volume means you might wait, pay more, or move the price yourself.

twist.text: A stock can have high volume on panic days and near-zero on calm days. Liquidity isn't constant.

climax.text: During the 2020 crash, even liquid stocks saw spreads widen 10x. Liquidity dries up exactly when you need it.

punchline.text: Liquidity is a fair-weather friend. Don't assume it'll be there in a storm.

quiz.question: What happens to bid-ask spreads when trading volume drops sharply?
options: Spreads widen, making trades more expensive
Trading volume has no effect on spreads
